overweight.translation[0].definitions[0]: someone who is overweight is too heavy and fat
overweight.translation[0].definitions[1]: something such as a package that is overweight weighs more than it is supposed to weigh
My luggage was overweight by five kilos.
overweight.translation[0].note_box[0].se: He was tall and slightly overweight.
He’s a bit overweight, not too much.
Being seriously overweight doubles the risk of heart disease.
The vet said the dog was grossly overweight and that it was affecting his heart.
I’m about 15 pounds overweight right now.
overweight.translation[1].definitions[0]: an overweight organization has too many people working for it
The company is considered to be overweight and overbureaucratic.
overweight.translation[1].definitions[1]: if someone is overweight in a particular type of investment in relation to other investments they hold, they have more of it than is usual, or more of it than they should have
He suggested portfolio managers be overweight in shares in electronics, machine tool makers and utilities.
Most people were overweight in the dollar because they believed in a US economic recovery.
